sentence: Tell me how it is efficient to buy more toy  rockets for Donald Trump's billionaire friends while parents can't  afford groceries.

sentence: The President should start to listen to the  American people, not his millionaire, billionaire friends.

sentence: They are still adding  nearly $4 trillion to the national budget to give tax breaks to their  wealthy billionaire friends.

sentence: Then they turn around and hand the savings over to their  billionaire friends.

sentence: However, if you go to the grocery stores, if you see the price of  beef, if you look at the price of coffee, if you feel that the economy  is suffering as a result of these tariffs, if you think the economy for  the average, everyday American is as good as those billionaire friends  that the President has, then you vote with the President.

sentence: President Trump ran on a promise to cut energy costs in  half his first year, but now Republicans and their billionaire friends  are only making themselves richer while sending Americans' utility  bills through the roof.

sentence: His  dream is to fully extend more than $4.5 trillion worth of tax breaks to  his billionaire friends and the wealthiest corporations in the world.
title: Concurrent Resolution on the Budget for Fiscal Year 2025

sentence: I have said before but it bears repeating: President Trump will  always help his billionaire friends at the cost of helping you.

He is trying to gut our healthcare systems and saddle  generations of our people with trillions of dollars in debt so that he  and his billionaire friends can have a few more tax breaks and a few  more toys in their collection.
title: We Say No

sentence: Trump and congressional Republicans had no problem giving their  billionaire friends tax breaks in their big, ugly bill, but they refuse  to extend tax credits that make healthcare more affordable for millions  of middle-class families.

sentence: Speaker, let me say this once again: We will not stand by and  watch Trump and his billionaire friends destroy this country without  putting up one hell of a fight.

sentence: Project 2025 lays out a blueprint for ending the Federal Government's  role in public education, starting with dismantling the Department of  Education, so that they can find the money they need to provide tax  breaks for their billionaire friends.

sentence: For the sake of enriching himself and his billionaire friends, Trump  went further to undermine our national security by loosening President  Biden's export controls on advanced chip sales to build data centers in  Saudi Arabia and the UAE.

sentence: Trump's cronies are lighting the house on fire so their  billionaire friends can sell the ashes for profit.
